Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Ian L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in March.The reception staff were extremely helpfull answering all our questions on the best way to get to places and very polite.Really enjoyed it , we ended up having breakfast here instead of looking for somewhere to eat.A little pricey but no complaints , plenty of choice.Its an easy walk to 2 metro stations 5 to 10 mins.Room was clean and quiet , and would definetly go back there.Taxi rank right outside .Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel: great room, good location”
Reviews.Author: Dave E
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. I was very impressed with the room - good size, clean. Bathroom was great with a powerful shower (although the bath tub is too small to have a bath!). We were given a bowl of fruit in our room as a welcome which was a nice touch. Location of the hotel is about 30 minute walk from Las Rambes but only a 10 minute walk from a Metro station. Shope & restaurants only a 10 minute walk away. I would recommend paying for breakfast (or make sure it's included in the cost of your stay). Breakfast is everything you'd want (hot & cold food, wide selection) & stays open until 11am if you want to have a lie in! What stops this being an excellent experience? Staff could have been more helpful & polite on check in & the area is okay but you wouldn't want to be out late at night. But overall, I had a good expereince & would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, well worth a look.”
Reviews.Author: Littlemammiesboy
Reviews.Content: First of all to clear up any confusion. 8 minutes walk to Urgell metro station. 20 minutes walk to the top of Las Ramblas. Now to review. Good hotel, rooms were modern and nice, bathroom also good. Only gripes - the bathplug was slightly too small and let some water out. Only a tiny bit though and not worth complaining about. Lots of bakeries, shops etc around it. Staff are fantastic, very pleasant all the time and allowed us to store our bags etc. Didn't have the breakfast option as we just ate locally. All in all, great hotel, great staff and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money....”
Reviews.Author: Alex S
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just returned from a three night stay at the Amister and are both completely satisfied with our choice of hotels. The staff were extremely friendly and polite and struck us as very happy to help. Our room was not only modern and well laid out, but extremely clean -which is always nice. The hotel in general has a modern feel to it without trying too hard. From reading other reviews, it seems the location and distance was an issue for some people -We found it ideal as we both like a walk, and at twenty minutes into the heart of town it wasn't too tiring. There are a few smaller local shops dotted about closer to the hotel should you need them also. All in all, taking into account price, I would happily recommend Amister to others.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed the hotel and WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Ciaranamow
Reviews.Content: The room was really nice. The workers were very hospitable and the WiFi was awesome. The WiFi was covered in the entire building. Also, breakfast was included and absolutely delicious!! The eggs....gotta get them. Fresh fruit! Fresh juice! Bacon, eggs....the works!! It's lit to reply cute with snowflakes dangling from the floors and the set up of the hotel is so unique. As far as location, its not too far from the La Ramblas. It was a 6euro cab ride to get the the La Ramblas. It's still downtown, but away from all the hustle. I definitely would return. My only suggestion would be to have more English speaking tv channels, since you're located in a tourist area. Just a suggestion

Reviews.Title: “Good, not very centric hotel”
Reviews.Author: Makilaki
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights beginning of December in Barcelona. The hotel is not close to the center of the city and it takes some walking to reach the metro station or bus station. For example, it takes about 20 minutes walk to reach piazza Espana walking, but it would also take pretty much the same amount of time by means of public transport. The rooms at the hotel are spacious, the bathroom and the amenities just fine. I stayed at the room with the view to the inside of the building, and would not recommend the view, so book a room with a better view. The safe box in the room was not working, and they never fixed it, although the staff was asked several times. Also, in my room the wifi connection didn't work, so I was provide a cable for a lan connection. The breakfast was OK, except when there are large groups, the staff cannot provide on time service, simply because there is enough of them. All in all, the hotel is a good choice for the money, the only thing is that it is just not very conveniently located to the public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a short trip - business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Toltriaco
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Amister in November 2011 for a conference. The rooms are modern, bathrooms are a good standard, all was clean and tidy. Note that there are no irons in the room. It is a short walk from the main train station where you can get shuttles to the airport. This is not the heart of Barcelona but the Arena shopping center is not far, nor is the Placa d'Espanya. Placa de Catalunya is a bit further - maybe 20 minutes by foot. Breakfast buffet was quite good - selection of meats and cheeses, breads, fruit, etc. Most people should be quite satisfied here. Large conference room in lower level is not ideal - no windows and two poorly-placed pillars make it awkward. But if you are not using this facility and only need a hotel as base for tourism or business, this is a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a city break.”
Reviews.Author: aggy73
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Barcelona in Oct half term for a week long break as a family of 3. We booked a superior family room at this hotel. We stayed for 8 days. The hotel was very clean. It was within a 10 minute walk of the nearest Metro Stop - Hospital-Clinic. We had the breakfast for 5 days of our stay which cost 30 Euros per day for the family. The breakfast was of a decent standard and we found it helped set us up for the day as it meant we were not wandering around trying to decide where to go for breakfast. (We had enough of that at lunch and dinner) The hotel is only 3 stops on the metro (with 1 change) from the Place de Catalunya and the heart of the city. We went to the Camp Nou twice and got a taxi back to the hotel after both games. Taxi cost 10 Euros first time and 7 Euros the second so very reasonable. We left the hotel at 5am in the morning for an early morning flight and the taxi transfer cost 35 Euros. All in all - this hotel is ideal for a break in Barcelona, not in the heart of the city but do not listen to reviews that say it is to far from the metro - it is at best a 10 minute walk there and we would often get a metro back and then have a drink and a coffee in one of the cafes, bars in the local vicinity which were far cheaper than in the city centre. Whilst in Barcelona if you are looking for a fun way to see the city have a go at a bike tour of the city run by this company. http://fattirebiketours.com/

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: SaGo82
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel half way between the Ramblas and La Espanya. It is a very reasonable hotel with good quality bed and service. We did not have the breakfast as it was fairly expensive and there are other places close by to go. Although it is not right in the centre of everything it does mean that it is slightly more relaxed around the area. There is a 5-10minute walk to the metro which sometimes was a bit tiring but not too bad. Overall a very good hotel in a reasonable location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a difficult city where to find one!”
Reviews.Author: latakia
Reviews.Content: First of all, it is not easy to find a good hotel, in a good location, not extremely expensive in Barcelona. We went for 4 nights in May to Amister and overall we liked. A major concern is the location though, it is far from everything, metro station included, and all the sightseeing. I booked this one following the reviews and I think the overall judgement on Amister is correct, it is good, new, nicely furnished. For breakfast, there are a lot of good and inexpensive options around, never tried the hotel one. For dinner, the situation is more complicated - we were advised by the hotel staff of some restaurant not far call Mediterranean or something like that. Please don't go, they pretend to be upscale, they say "oh, you don't have a reservation? Oh, let me see, what we can do..." while the restaurant is empty...Expensive also and food not great. So no concerns on facilities or rooms, the hotel is new. Again my main concern is the distance from everything. I understand Barcelona is not a city where the things to see are all together, like Madrid, but still every morning you need to do 15 minutes walking to the metro station, and at night it is not the best walk you might want to do (and I am used to this kind of things...). So - if you are a fancy fashionable lady not ready to walk, or your wife/girlfriend is, you better look for something else or be ready to pay for lots of cabs! Would I go again? Yes - but first I would look for something else, even though I know it's tough.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: nikom83
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, big and clean. the double bed was huge. The bathroom was big too. everything was ok. Our reservation was whithout breakfast because it cost about 11 euros/day. Too much! Although there are around many bakers and supermarkets so you can have a cheper breakfast. The only negative was that there isn't balkony, only window and our room had view of skylight....there wasn't enough fresh air. Although I recommend it without any doubt!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 123walker
Reviews.Content: it is a nice hotel with an arty flair. my room was large and nice. the breakfast is good. i would recommend this hotel for a vacation in barcelona. i would choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: oliviiia
Reviews.Content: nice and friendly! clean not far awy from city centre, but they supose tell me - everything from mini bar is extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Thomas3103
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience in this hotel. Staff is very friendly and helpful and they speak many languages. Clean and nice rooms...all amenities are there and working. Great location in the middle of l'éixample area. 10 minutes walk from the man train station Sants where you can take a train to Sitges ( 30 minutes) for a very nice beach experience. The hotel is great in showing you how and where to go. Will be back in Amister on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well-appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: gnomike
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great option for those who wish to be a little off the beaten track while still close to all the touristy sites. If you want to be in the 'heart of the action', then this hotel is not for you. It is for you if you like the thought of a quiet refuge from the busier parts of the city that is still centrally located and within easy reach of everything. The wi-fi is free, but you won't always get a clear signal. Our room was very modern, spotless, and comfy.... but small. No problem for us. Near to the hotel were some good eating options, grocery stores, and public transportation. Note that is is NOT on the popular hop-on/hop-off bus routes (nearest stop about 15 min walk away)

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing hotel for a weekend family stay”
Reviews.Author: sepcm91
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amister for a long weekend. Parents plus an active 8 year old. Read the reviews and was a bit concerned. We were pleased when we arrived. Very helpful staff. A large room with air conditioning. Bright, fresh and insultaed from sound. 10 minute walk to one large train station as well as metro station. Very nice breakfast buffet and a small bar for the afternoon if you want to put your feet up. We can warmly recommend it. If you need a full service hotel, don't use this, but if you are a routine traveller and enjoy a walk about, tis is the perfect place. Note, if you are used to eating dinner before 20:00 then you need to have a plan. The hotel does recommend one cafe a few blocks away which accomodates tourists who eat earlier than the Spaniards (and it was excellent) . If you have younhger children be prepared to eat before you head back in for the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: frjohnsen
Reviews.Content: Amister is a nice hotel, with fairly large rooms, in a quiet area of Barcelona. If you have to live within walking distance to La Rambla, this hotel might be a bit off, as it takes a good 20 minutes to walk to Placa de Catalunya. That said, taking a cab will probably not cost more than 5-7 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: HMMA
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. Very comfortable bed and quiet at night. Good breakfast. The location is not bad but the metro stations are a bit far.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location, Informative Staff”
Reviews.Author: belandseb
Reviews.Content: Soon after checking in, the front desk staff pulled out a map and showed us the locations of the best attractions. It was very helpful and appreciated. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We found the hotel to a little far from many of the hot spots. It was very cold which made the walk seem that much farther. Looking back, I would look for a hotel near the Gothic Quarter. But overall Amister was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel which had family rooms”
Reviews.Author: Paddyclamp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel mainly because it had family rooms (not that easy to come by!). The hotel is modern, bright and clean. It has a really nice layout, no spooky corridors and the rooms are good, nice bathroom and free WIFI. Didn't try the breakfast so can't comment on that. It is a little bit away from La Rambla but it is within walking distance and there is a subway station just a short distance away at Hospital Clinic on L5 (blue line) of the metro. There were a couple of little playgrounds within sight of the hotel which were a hit with the kids! When i go back to Barcelona I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, would go back!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lfbourton402
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a lovely 4 star hotel, it is on a main road however noise at nighttime was minimal, the location is not bad out of the centre but very easy to get around by using either buses or the metro. the staff were friendly and helpful, on arrival we received a map and city guide for Barcelona. the room was great and very spacious with a nice bathroom with bath and shower, the room had a safe, tv, wardrobe, full length mirror, you can have a smoking or non smoking room, desk and chairs, we had a twin beds, which were comfortable for european standards! this hotel is very clean and modern, found a fantastic deal through booking.com and would defiantly go back. the hotel offers free wifi for all guests, the hotel do offer room service and breakfast. so much to see and do in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Good price/value ratio”
Reviews.Author: gorenyy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Amister 4 nights and it was definitely a great experience and good price/value ratio deal. Rooms are very clean, service and personnel are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I wanna go home!”
Reviews.Author: Danthearsenalman
Reviews.Content: Nothing like in the pictures. The 11 euro breakfast is cold horrible with poor selection. Location isnt too bad but don't expect reception to give ya directions. They don't like humans. Very disappointed! Pay the extra 20 euro and stay at the grab Sofia where breakfast is included and the staff have blood throwing through there veins. Also if woken by workmen drilling on the lobby do not mention that they woke you. You will be told you are lazy and should be awake already (then probably castrated but we ran away) [--]

Reviews.Title: “A nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenBoy21
Reviews.Content: Excellent clean hotel very friendly staff would recommend. Only drawback is that there is no bar otherwise I would have given it 5!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty & Rude Staff AND Stolen Ipod!”
Reviews.Author: KNYC22
Reviews.Content: The hotel room had dirty carpet so if you stay bring slippers, one bed was like a murphy style bed which was extremely uncomfortable, furniture was also stained, smelled like smoke, the best thing about the room was the bathroom which didn't seem like it belonged with the room. The staff was rude especially a man named Issac! We had a safe in our room which we locked our passports in but I made the mistake of not including my Ipod. When we went to leave I realized it was missing from a specific place I had stored it inside a bag so not to carry it around on the trip. The location wasn't terrible but it's definitely about a 20 min walk to Las Ramblas. If you can find a better deal, I wouldn't recommend this place. If you have to stay here, lock up ALL of your valuables!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Nontourist area”
Reviews.Author: mky84
Reviews.Content: This place is a good looking hotel overlooking a busy street, but I discovered the first night that it wasn't really in an ideal spot. My wife and I are both young, so we didn't mind the walking, but walking was a little inconvenient when it started raining. It was about 15 minutes to the Plaza Catalunya and 30 minutes to the other end of La Rambla, 30 minutes of walking to Plaza Espanya, and about 10 minutes to the nearest Metro station. What I liked about the location was that it was in between Montjuic and La Rambla, so that walking was an option to both. I think if I were to do it over, I'd probably get a hotel closer to La Rambla so that the beach, the Barri Gotic, and the hot spots would be closer. That being said, I am very appreciative of the great service, the spacious, clean rooms, and fast, free Wi-Fi. I booked this hotel via hotels.com and they were running a deal where the 3rd night was free. It was an absolute steal.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star hotel for 3 star price”
Reviews.Author: Retyred
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Amister. The staff were very helpful and all the people on the front desk spoke english. The rooms were modern and the beds were kingsize. Very quiet even though we were facing the main street we slept well for our 3 nights there. I would recommend the breakfast buffet as it was quite extensive for the price. A 15 minute walk to the Rambla but that explains the great price.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, clean and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: emreacmaz
Reviews.Content: We had stayed for our honeymoon in Amister Hotel. Hotel is about 20 minutes distance from city centre (Ra Lambra) and 5 minutes distance from metro station(Hospital Clinic). It has friendly personel and quiet atmospere. Breakfast is not included but it worths to eat, it is delicious. Rooms are clean and appropriate size.

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: Budagali
Reviews.Content: I was abit worried after reading certain reviews. However we had such an amazing stay at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is central and walking distance to popular places like the Rambla, Passieg de Gracia and so on. We enjoyed our stay and we definately look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: Tita1953
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin... Hotel room was spacious and very clean. It had a good size bathroom and shower. The breakfast every morning was delicious and everything was very fresh every day. The hotel attendants were very helpful as to where to go and where to eat close by. Everyone was very helpful that we had contact with at the hotel. The area surrounding the the hotel was very safe to walk around in during the day as well as the evening. I loved it there and in Barcelona in general.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, big bed”
Reviews.Author: Lucas27
Reviews.Content: Easy to walk there from Sants Station (20 mins straight walk with cases). A nice 10 minute stroll to Metro then easy access everywhere. Some sights walkable from hotel (25 mins to Gaudi buildings, Rambla). Metro and buses are cheap, clean and efficient but we preferred to walk to see all the wonderful buildings along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: Shelleygw
Reviews.Content: Great friendly staff, really close to metro line, lovelly locals. Fab extra extra large bed! on our check in we were given some great easy to understand infomation at the desk, they included a map and pointed out the best way to access tourist sites. really lovely and warm staff, bright and modern hotel, highly reconmended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: syoban
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. The staff at reception are nice especially the man that works the night shift. They where very helpful and spoke excellent english. However we were not given any maps, tourist information etc. on arrival. We had to ask about everything. Also there is no tourist information booklet in the room which i think would be very helpful . You get a discount on the " Bus Touristic " ( open top bus tour ) by the way, which is really good. We did the 2 day tour and thought it was brilliant. The room we got on the first night was at the back of the hotel and was not very nice, it was very small and looked out on to a very dark area with NO natural light. The next morning we asked to be moved to the front of the hotel which was no problem at all. We got a twin room which was fine, just join the beds together ! We got breakfast one morning which costs 10.80 euro. A bit expensive but it was really nice and the selection of food was brilliant. Overall it is a nice hotel but not amazing. It is about a 10-15 minute walk to the metro station which takes you where ever you want to go. It took us about 40 minutes to walk to Las Ramblas ! It is definately not in a great location. To get from the airport just get the RENFE to Sants Estacio, costs 3 euro and takes 20 mins. Then its a 10/15 min walk to the hotel. The selection of room service is poor and it is only available until 11pm. The only english speaking stations on the TV are CNN and BBC news. Being ther for 6 nights it would have been nice to watch a bit of TV. The hotel did leave us a basket of fruit in our room which was a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Barcelona - we loved it”
Reviews.Author: SteveMichelle
Reviews.Content: We had a long weekend with friends staying at the Amister Hotel, we arrived at around 10.30 p.m to a friendly welcome at the Hotel, we were registered and given our room cards explained hotel breakfast etc. and given details of area and maps of Barcelona and info on getting around on tour bus metro etc. Very impressed with room on 7th floor large bed really comfortable lovely and clean. It was about a 25min walk to the playa de catalunya which is a good place to catch the red and blue route tour bus (if you buy a ticket for two days its cheaper and a really good way to get your bearings in the city as it is vast). Its also at the top of Las Ramblas and near the gaudi house 'casa Batilo' on Pg. de Gracia, nice shops there too. Can't explain in writing here how much we enjoyed our break, just go there and enjoy take comfy shoes and learn a little Spanish, We will definately be going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot - comfort and style!”
Reviews.Author: K_Q_10
Reviews.Content: Stylish building, rooms. The bathroom was very spacious and beautifully appointed. We were advised by email that they could not confirm in advance whether we would get a room with a king bed or two twins. Fortunately, they were able to accommodate our request when we arrived. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful and knowledgeable about the area. Our room faced the light well, but at least it was quiet. The beds were very comfortable and we slept very well.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff and very professional, hotel was beautiful and really clean”
Reviews.Author: darrenrainey
Reviews.Content: 15 minute walk from city centre, a lot of bistros and bars close bye, all the restaurants seem to be spanish style and not very many englsh speaking staff, however staff in the hotel where fantastic and spoke very good english, would reccomend the open top tourist bus tour, this was very reasonably priced and very useful, the tour bus takes you to every site possible that you would want to see and you can get on and off the tour bus at your leisure

Reviews.Title: “Basic, comfortable hotel not too removed from center city.”
Reviews.Author: Itchy-Ban
Reviews.Content: Booked Amister over the internet. Room was fine. We arrived early and it wasn't ready, so we went for a bite to eat and came back at 2 pm and it was all set. Took awhile to realize that when you pull the keycard from the slot on the wall, the little frig also turns off. Very quite room, somewhat small, but we didn't spend much time there. Staff was helpful if somewhat aloof. Reasonably priced and it a decent location unless you need to be in a real touristy hotspot. The 7th floor didn't have its own wifi hub and reception was touch and go in our room which was a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Edcanstay
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a new residential area, with many hospital clinics etc in the area, even a metro station named Hospital Clinic! I is probably 8 or so blocks to the main action of the shopping belt or La Rambla, but its a nice 15-20 min walk, or 6 or so Euro in a taxi. The hotel was clean and modern, although it had a clinical feel about it. The Reception staff were helpful, with special mention to Cristina, who was very helpful with information and assistance with booking tours, flamenco etc. The room was spacious for European standards, with nice amenities. We did not try the breakfast at 10.70 Euro pp. We are not big eaters, and for under 10 Euro, we could get a feed of bakery items, with juice and coffees. My one complaint about the hotel is they oversold themselves on the first night of 5. We arrived about 6:30pm, having prepaid for the first night, booking a double room. Nothing was mentioned at reception, but upon entering our room on 2nd floor, we noticed it was two singles pushed together. We left luggage in the room, wanting to go out for some food, via reception, asking, nicely, if a Double room was available, as per the booking. Cristina advised they we fully booked, and the twin room type was all that was available. (Now this is not acceptable!) Cristina quickly offered to get us a room on the 7th Floor, with a King Bed for the following nights, which was accepted, and turned out to be nice. There are a few nice Tapas bars/Restaurants in the area, where you can get genuine local food, at regular prices. A special mention to O'Tubo.

Reviews.Title: “Good central-ish hotel with parking next door”
Reviews.Author: awayfrommydesk99
Reviews.Content: We stayed (4 of us in a family room) for two nights. Good room, great staff, but probably better for a family with smaller children than ours (11 and 14) as one of them preferred to sleep on the floor than share the sofa bed...That said the larger bed was gigantic and super-comfy. The other thing to check is the metro stop location - it's a bit of a walk and is on the blue line, so you might need to make more changes than you'd like. We needed somewhere to park we were touring around, and the parking was next door and 25 euros a day - which wasn't too bad given the location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little gem in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: StargirlScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and absolutely loved it. The staff are friendly and helpful, both the hotel and rooms were clean and contemporary. The bed was huge and sooooo comfy! Just remember to open the blackout curtains a wee bit or you could sleep forever! The safe was such a bonus, as was the mini bar which can be used for keeping water in (and beer)! Which is a great option to have. The bathroom is great and the shower is pretty decent. Air conditioning in the room was a great bonus and the area was quiet so noise was not a problem. The free wifi was a nice bonus but it was a weak signal so could only be got in certain areas of the room. There was complimentary fruit too which would have been a nice touch if the grapes hadn't been so wrinkly! The hotel is only about a 10/15 minute walk from one of the tourist bus stops and only really a 15 min walk from the station(train and bus together). The airport bus collects just 5 blocks from the hotel and you can get dropped about the same distance again when you arrive. We discovered on the last day that if you turn left out of the hotel and take the first right there are supermarkets up that street which is great for water/beer/breakfast options. We managed to walk to Las Ramblas in about 25 mins and the one way streets make walking around the town pretty easy. But there are bus/ metro options pretty close if need be. There are a few wee cafe's and restaurants nearby. If you head a couple of blocks either forward or behind the hotel then there are some larger hotels and restaurants. There are a lot of lovely restaurants in particular 2/3 blocks behind the hotel, all around that area. They were happy to keep our bags for us too after we checked out which was great : ) Really lovely time spent here. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - nice people”
Reviews.Author: mvsteve
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our cruise for one night. We booked it because they have a quadruple room. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The room was very clean and comfortable and it was a great hotel. It seems misplaced, however, because it's in a not so great part of town. It's not scary or anything, just lacking in restaurants and stores. It's off the beaten path, but still accessible because there are so many cabs available.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Comfort with a Hint of Tackiness”
Reviews.Author: monkeyface09
Reviews.Content: Situated in a calm residential area, this hotel is hard to miss with the name in big, bright pastel block lettering across the front windows. The IKEA-style pop decor continues throughout the hotel but the rooms are tastefully minimalist and surprisingly spacious for Europe. Although their welcome fruit basket is a nice gesture, informing guests when they check in or calling the room prior to delivery would be preferable to a surprising knock on the door, especially when some guests may not wish to be disturbed after a long flight. It also seems a bit pointless to leave notes every time the morning housekeeping shift misses a room since they usually get cleaned later in the day. Nevertheless, overall comfort and hospitable staff make it easier to overlook odd policies and minor inconveniences, including the awkward placement of toilet paper and a dirty mini-bar. Although the hotel is a little far from most of the action around town, it is a five-minute walk to the metro and there are several bike stations in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: codsallStourbridgeUK
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Amister and it is everything that everyone else says about it: an excellent hotel with good clean quiet rooms that are serviced every day. The staff are very friendly and helpful. At €10 the breakfasts may seem expensive but it is an all-you-can-eat buffet and good value. Lift up the big silver lid – took a day to ‘discover’ this – and you’ll find bacon, sausage and scrambled egg! There are cafés nearby, but they didn’t always open when they said they did. Spain doesn’t seem to have a smoking ban in bars, cafés and restaurants, so that needs to be borne in mind as well, but the hotel is non-smoking. Other reviews, plus the hotel’s website, mention that the en suite’s have a bathtub; implying that they lack a shower. Don’t be put off by this – there is a shower IN the bathtub and a non-slip surface there too! The rooms have a TV plus a CD player, so you can take your own music or check CDs you buy! There is also a baffling modem system on the TV which is supposed to show local arts films, but we couldn't get it to work! The Amister is nicely located. Barcelona Sants Station – where the train from the airport drops you – is 15-20 mins walk along Avinguda de Roma. A few Metro stations are just a few blocks away from the hotel. We found Rocafort Station, on Line 1 (red) the closest – you need a map (hotel provided us with one for free) to find your surroundings. Other reviews mention the T-10 tickets for public transport in Barcelona. We cannot recommend these more highly; in fact we got through 2 of them each in just 4 days! They include local trains, the Metro, buses, trams and cover the journey to and from the airport. They are just €7.95 each and have to be endorsed in a machine on each trip. By far the best way to get around is by the Metro. If you are in any way familiar with the London Underground then this will be not be alien to you. However, here, as everywhere else in Barcelona, you need to be very wary of pickpockets. We saw one incident and had at least one close shave! You also need to pay attention to the turnstiles at the Metro Stations; the newer ones work as ours do – you put your ticket in on the right – but in older ones if you do this, the turnstile to your right is freed and some lucky person gets a free ride on you!

Reviews.Title: “Right place for very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jakson_69
Reviews.Content: Room where we stayed was very good size for that location. Room with King size bed and sofa bed and you still space to move in room. Cararge is next building And just five a bloc a way is area with small restaurants. we have excelent dinner at restaurant Routa., modern restaurant with scandinavian touch

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, friendly staff and great value”
Reviews.Author: yorkshire_boys
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and was very impressed with the hotel, it was very clean and the staff were all very good first class service from when we got there and to the very second we left. We loved it that much that we will be looking to stay there again for a short break because the price for what you got can not be beaten. So book it and enjoy Barcelona as much as we did, missing it all ready :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: louise017
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights at this hotel and were pleased with it. Everywhere is spotless and the staff are really helpful and friendly. The rooms are comfortable and the air con was very efficient in the sweltering heat. Breakfast was good with a great range to choose from. We felt very safe and secure in the area and we can definatly reccommend the beer in the bar next door! Look for offers on the Hotel website. We had 3 nights for the price of 2 which made this hotel excellent value. The only thing that may be an issue is that it is 10 mins walk from the nearest metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but effective”
Reviews.Author: DanAndFe
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice, modern hotel. Other reviewers have said it lacks atmosphere and character, which I would agree with, but it's not really that sort of hotel. It small and quiet and very understated. It's also very clean and nicely decorated. The staff were very friendly and helpful - we arrived there at 3am, due to a 5 hour delay to our flight (thanks to an air traffic controllers strike in France) so the poor man on the front desk had to stay up way past his bed time, but he was still very understanding and welcoming. The location is good as long as you're relatively fit and active - it took us about 20 minutes to walk to La Rambla. However, none of the cab drivers at the airport had ever heard of the hotel, and we only managed when I showed the driver a Google Map on my phone - which kind of gave us the impression that it's a bit "off the beaten track". The restaurant is basic (and only seemed to serve breakfast) but this was fine for us and the food was perfectly adequate. Our room was fairly standard - decent size, nice big bed, satellite tv, big window with a fairly pleasant city view, minibar, free safe. Not amazing, but I certainly wouldn't say there was anything wrong with it. Overall, I'd say it was a very good choice. If I had to pick a fault with it, it would be the location - not a problem for me but I imagine a lot of people would want to be closer to the city centre, or a metro station. Other than that, a pleasant, simple hotel that was perfect for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but lacking atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: ruadh_ruadh
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a trip we were taking to see Barcelona play in the Nou Camp. It's a nice hotel but it seemed kind of lifeless. There was no bar or restaurant so that probably has something to do with it. It was a pity because we would have loved to have stayed around for a drink. Like I said, it's a lovely hotel. It is not centrally located but that was not an issue for us because we wanted somewhere outside of La Rambles and nearer to the Nou Camp-it's between the two. We walked everywhere, we didn't find it an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. I would aim to stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Where_2_nextthen?
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through an online agent and got a reasonable price. I wasn't sure what to expect but was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel was in a very good state of repair and was exceptionally clean. It was fitted very modernly, but still seemed relatively classy and had a very comfortable feel to it. This was particularly true for the room, although the lobby was on the 'clinical' side. There was a nice lounge area with artwork. I didn't take the breakfast so can't comment on the hotel food. The staff were welcoming, and pleasant with greetings at other times. they were helpful for the few questions I asked, and voluntarily gave a map and miniature tour guide for the city. The free internet was excellent, with an excellent signal in my room on the second floor, and no difficulties accessing for the whole 5 day stay. My only comment would be that I underestimated (consistently through my stay) the walking times and distances in the city, and it did take longer than I expected to get into the centre (La Rambla) area, and it was a solid 1 hour or so to walk to the zona universitaria (for conference). It was also probably a good 30 minute brisk walk from the Sagrada. That said, there were many good looking restaurants and bars nearby in the eixample area, and the food I had in this area was substantially better than the food I had on La Rambla. There were also 3 metro stations near to the hotel (within 5-10 minutes walk). All in all I was very impressed by the hotel and would certainly stay here again on a future visit if I needed to be in a similar part of town.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful and considerate hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanJamesWright
Reviews.Content: A simply fabulous hotel in a brilliant location. Eixample is a lovely part of town and the hotel is within 10 minutes of a number of metro stops that can whisk you all over the city. When our flight was cancelled the staff were absolutely magnificent in there help for us. Also loved the art in the lobby. A great and wonderful hotel, i would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Botique Hotel That Is A Class Act”
Reviews.Author: Patagandia
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Amister Hotel were extremely helpful and friendly and made our stay in Barcelona even better. Both our room and the hotel were very clean and had modern furnishings. The room was nice sized and comfortable for 3 people (a king bed and king sleeper sofa). The neighborhood is safe and quieter at night than the central part of Barcelona. Barcelona is concentrated, and most attractions are easily accessible by subway (a 10 minute stroll from the hotel) or by taxi (reasonable priced and plentiful). There are lots of good tapas restaurants and places for breakfast close by that are easy on the wallet. Go with what the desk staff recommends. All in all, Barcelona is a fabulous city to visit, and the Amister Hotel added to the experience especially by focusing on personal service.

Reviews.Title: “Smart boutique hotel in a smart, residential area”
Reviews.Author: pea-n-pod
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amister Hotel for three nights and found it to be a lovely hotel. The staff are very helpful and polite, the rooms are large and well equipped. The bathrooms are nice, but the heat of the water can be a bit hit and miss and the bath is very low! On the whole, we found this hotel to be well located, if just a little off the beaten track, but everywhere was easily accessible. You can get to the hotel from Sants railway station on foot - really easy to find and about a ten minute walk down a wide main street. The journey from the airport to Sants is direct and takes about half an hour and costs E3 each way. The area itself felt very safe - I was a little worried about all the advice about pick-pockets etc, but we found the Exiample area to be quiet, safe and refined.

Reviews.Title: “Dirtiest floors I've ever seen in a hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Mojofarm
Reviews.Content: The staff were a bit on the aloof side, though helpful with maps. There was an art piece in the lobby I really liked, and I'll always have a positive association with the hotel because our 11 month-old took his very first steps there... however, the carpeted floor was very very dirty. When I brought it up, and asked to make sure it would be vacuumed for the next night, the concierge said, a little stuffily, "the floors are vacuumed daily." Okay, so maybe the vacuum's been broke for the last six month, or maybe the maid sneaks an extra smoke break when no one suspects it, I don't know, but the little ones clothes were dirty, and after a couple stocking-footed hours my white socks looked as though I'd walked a dirt road.

Reviews.Title: “I would love to stay in this hotel and the next time!”
Reviews.Author: natassap76
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, very clean - adequately equipped - comfortable and cosy room, very nice bathroom. Location convenient since the city center is within 20 minutes on foot, 5-10 minutes by bus.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel....liked the boutique feel to it”
Reviews.Author: miz84
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in Barca!!....v loved the boutique feel this hotel had...v had a triple occupancy room....the room was soo nice and spacious and well kept...great room service...the room has good amenities...very very close to a five star hotel... THe only disadvantage is that the hotel is not in d heart of the party district.....Ramblas is a half n hour walk or u have to walk to nearest metro station and change two trains...but v didnt mind it...Barca is super fun....n amister added to it....v were soo relieved to have an awesome room to come home to and crash!! The hotel staff is very helpful n friendly .....we were a lil upset wen they didnt allow us a late check out as they were sold out....me n my cuzins loved it and recommend u go there tooo....its really affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Definately value for money.”
Reviews.Author: cskbroughton
Reviews.Content: Booked a 4 day trip with my wife for a surprise 30th. Arrived early evening after a very easy connection from the airport to Barca Sants station, then only a 10 min walk to hotel. Check-in swift and polite, staff happy to provide maps and suggestions for good local restaurants. Room exceptionally clean and modern, everything required for short stay. Decent location to attractions/metro/train. One definate must when in Barcelona is the Barcelona card!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: alanhicks
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights to celebrate my wife's birthday. The weather was fantastic with temperatures up in the 30s. The air con in the rooms was superb and kept us very comfortable onec out of the heat. The hotel reception staff were extremely friendly and all spoke ver good English which is a real plus to us as we know little Spanish. The hotel is well placed for most amenities with the nearest tour bus stop 10 minutes off and the ramblas a leisurely 20 minutes away. I would certainly recommend this hotel and when in Barcelona again will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, helpful”
Reviews.Author: ayla34
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room for 4 for 4 nights this summer. The room was very comfortable for 4. The desk staff was tremendously helpful directing us to various spots in the city and giving advice on dining spots. It is in a great location to walk to the Gaudi buildings. There was construction going on on the street [just as evereywhere else in Barcelona seemingly] but the noise wasn't a problem. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet,clean, friendly & helpful”
Reviews.Author: Banchoryloon
Reviews.Content: Located an easy €24 taxi ride from the airport, a quiet, clean and friendly hotel that welcomes you with a bowl of fresh fruit in your room. During a very hot August when you are out late, cool rooms with black out curtains allow you to sleep late ! Very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: acb99
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel purely for a room to sleep in. I cannot comment on the food as we ate in restaurants outside every day but the service was excellent. We arrived at 11 in the morning and went along simply to see if we could leave our luggage somewhere, they checked us in straight away and the room was lovely, brand new, nice size and with wonderful cooling air con. The room was clean and kept clean by the regular room service throughout the stay. The hotel receptionists all spoke english and were very helpful, when you first check in they provide you with a guide to barcelona and a map which served us well. The hotel is not as close to las ramblas as we had thought but it is definately not far, a five minute walk from the metro you can always hop on and las ramblas is one stop away. We chose to walk and it only took us 15 -20 minutes (depending on how the heat was effecting us) and it's a nice walk especially in the evening. The hotel is near most of the attractions and we used the metro to get to those that were further away. Definately reccomend this hotel for people wanting a comfortable room at a low price. I must say though if I had a higher budget I would opt for a hotel that is nearer las ramblas amidst the action.

Reviews.Title: “Modern (felt like the lobby was a contemporary museum, brand new, great value - LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: jenles530Nyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel made the exclusive Expedia® Insiders' Select™ list, which includes only the very best 1% of all our hotels and resorts, as rated by our millions of customers and our in-house experts. Expedia Insiders' Select Methodology: Traveler Opinions + Value + Expedia Hotel Expert input Expedia Insiders' Select score

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Closebutnocigar
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week. Arrived in the middle of the night because of delayed flight. Receptionist was very friendly and welcoming. We didn't trouble the staff a lot, but all our requests were met. The hotel seemed to be recently renovated. Quite stylish. Nice room on the 4th floor. Good isolation made traffic noise from busy street outside minimal. Air-conditioning worked. Room cleaned and towels changed every day. Hotel is close to the gay area of Barcelona. 5 minute walk to closest subway station. 8 euro taxi ride to Barceloneta beach. Our reservation didn't include breakfast, but many small cafes nearby wich offered menus (baguette, juice, coffee, danish pastry) for about 6-8 euro pr person. All in all a hotel that offered very good value for money (we payed about 75 euro per night), and I'm happy to recommend it to anyone who is not dependent on staying within walking distance of Las Ramblas!

Reviews.Title: “Amore Amister!”
Reviews.Author: Louiseoat
Reviews.Content: What can I say apart from GREAT HOTEL! My partner and I arrived at the Amister Hotel very late in the evening, the gentleman at reception was extremely nice when checking us in. He gave us a map of Barcelona and even highlighted tourist attractions, which we found very useful; the map was constantly with us throughout our trip. The Amister Hotel is a very modern hotel and the rooms were exceptionally clean, bright and comfortable offering a safe and mini bar. If you check-in late and room service are no longer serving then I would strongly recommend that you go and grab yourself a delicious pizza from literally around the corner. If you come out of the Amister turn right and you will come across a pizza restaurant, which you can order take-away from and eat in your room. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as we had read recent reviews that the Amister charges 13 Euros! To walk from the Amister to La Rambles you are looking at approximately a 25-30 minute walk, however you could take a cab, which takes about 10 minutes. If you are looking to taste typical plates of the Catalan Kitchen then you should pay a visit to Can Culleretes restaurant which is the oldest restaurant of Barcelona and the second oldest of Spain. The prices are reasonable and the service is superb! Overall we had a great holiday and the Amister Hotel played a huge part in it! If you are two minds to book this hotel then don’t be! I would definitely go back and stay at the Amister – We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Where should I start?”
Reviews.Author: JOSEPHINEHILTON
Reviews.Content: Where should I start? first, we booked Amister Apartments and only to be told 2days before our arrival that the apartments(x2) aren't ready, therefore we will be accommodated in the hotel instead! it started okay, getting picked up from the airport, then the driver seemed to be complaining regarding the pick up charges that was quoted by the hotel booking manager (he wanted more for what we could gather). The rooms are pretty average, tv didn't work properly, the safe decided to locked itself even with the code (we were told it was stuck and the maintenance man wasn't around at the time). Hotel staff was apologetic and said that there wasn't anything she could do apart from giving us some kind of device to pull the safe door. Then we requested to be picked up to go to the hotel the next day and was reassured that it would be booked for the discounted rate since we were inconvenienced once again... as we were checking out the next day for the London flight - the reception staff said that he didn't have any message from his colleague to book the car, and because it was a Sunday that there would be surcharge.. to make the long story short he suggested it would be cheaper if we catch a taxi - he estimated around 30Euro. We have our taxi at the last minute (yes, he forgotten to book it!).. got to the airport and was told by the driver that it would be 50Euro! So as much as we love the idea of holidaying in Barcelona, never again that I would be using this hotel (via lastminute.com) - by the way, our flights was also changed the night before without lastminute.com sending us a notification... NEVER AGAIN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel..a welcome break from the busy tourist centre”
Reviews.Author: BRISTOLSTAR
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in March 09 and found it to be very comfortable and immaculately clean. It is a bit further from the main sights than some other hotels but there are 2 metro stations within about 4-5 minutes walk and one of the main train stations about 10 minutes walk away. We actually found that being away from the main sights was a welcome relief after a busy day walking around and battling the crowds. You also get a better feel for the city as you can see the real side of city life in Barcelona and not just the tourists. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as we felt 12 euros per person per day was a liitle steep! Instead, we ate breakfast in local cafes which was a great experience. All the cafes we ate in were great value and the staff very friendly and helpful. We had a room on the 7th floor so could not hear the road noise. This may be a problem for lower floors as the hotel is on a fairly busy road. The room had a bath which was a welcome relief for aching muscles and feet (we walked a lot on this city break!). We didn't really have need to seek advice from hotel staff but they were helpful and courteous when we did. Barcleona is a wonderfl city with a bit of everything from nightlife, culture, shopping, beaches and everything else in between. This hotel was ideal for us and we would stay there again. One piece of advice...La Rambla is not a pleasant place at night...imtimidating and potentially dangerous in places. Not recommended

Reviews.Title: “great modern hotel very clean”
Reviews.Author: malibu71
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days.Modern minimal hotel, very clean and comfortable, lovely big bed. Traffic noise didnt bother us, didnt eat there as buffet breakfast was too expensive. Plenty of local cafes around the area to grab coffees and donuts, etc. Was a little far out, but we enjoy walking and walked every day to las ramblas, about 25 mins and then on to the beach another 20 mins on top. Great city, loads to see and do, we had gr8 weather but even with bad weather there is loads to see and do. Go visit Sagrada Familia, fantastic and awe inspiring! Dont go on the lift up there if you dont like heights, like i did, its very high!!Would go back to hotel and Barcelona tomorrow. If you are going for the beach a hotel nearer Las Ramblas or Place de Catalunya at the top of Las Ramblas would be more central.We ate at Bacco top of Las Ramblas, 60 euros for 2 inc wine. Very enjoyable and can recommend. Booked hol with Lastminute.com by far the cheapest for us. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, but bland”
Reviews.Author: Bermuda1Cheltenham
Reviews.Content: Stayed 23-26 May. Easy to get to by the Aerobus from outside the ariport. One-way ticket 4.24 Euros on board or return can be purchased from the ticket machine. Bus was the 6th stop, on Av De Roma. Currently the stop is outside 148-150 and the hotel is straight ahead for about 5 mins. The bus stop situ is variable at the moment as there is some major road works/construction along Av De Roma as a new Metro station is being built 200yrds or so from the hotel. Transfer takes about 30mins. Hotel is in a residential area, approx 20 mins walk from Rambla area, however there are Metro stops close by, Hospital Clinic being the nearest, about 5 mins. As long as you know before you go, that is fine. The hotel is quite and unassuming, however the staff are friendly, polite & efficient. The rooms are quite large, very clean and functional, however the decor throughout the hotel is predominently grey, with brown bathrooms, which is a little drab & soul-less. There are random words hanging on strings in the atrium which is a strange. Also a mini-fridge in the lobby/lounge area with free Red Bull! We took the advice of other Trip Advisor participants and gave the breakfast a miss as it wasnt included in our package. There are numberous pavement cafes and several supermarkets in close proximity. Barcelona itself was great. We bought a two day pass on the open top bus for 27 euros each. This took us to all the main tourist place and gave discounts to may of them. However the Metro is clean and easy to navigate. We also bought a T10 Metro ticket as mentioned by others for 7.70 euros. One thing we would mention is that we had a very near miss from having our bag snatched. We were sitting in a bench by the beach and there were three men on bicycles. One tapped my husband on the shoulder from behind and one of the others was going to grab the bad from the front. Fortunately a local lady tipped us off as to what was happening and the men rode away. Keep one hand on your bag at all times! Generally we found the people in Barcelona very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a fantastic city!”
Reviews.Author: nixsy1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mum on a sightseeing trip. It is perfect if you do not want to party/ go back out again in the evening, but we though it was a little too far from the centre, but it was much cheaper than hotels on the Ramblas,very well priced on lastminute.com. Also, room lovely, but no tea/coffee making facilities, and the room was very noisy with traffic due to being on a big busy main road. Apart from this though, a lovely, clean, modern hotel, well priced, and in my favourite city in Europe. There is so much to see and do in Barca, a city full of life aand culture.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel - close enough but not too close”
Reviews.Author: LindaNorfolk
Reviews.Content: What a lovely surprise this hotel was. Very modern and boutique hotel and the rooms were very comfortable and clean. Would definately stay again. Booked direct via the internet with no problems. Easy to find from the metro (Hospital Clinic about 5 mins quick walk). The hotel is about 20 mins slow walk from Las Ramblas just about right as it can get very noisy along that stretch. Loved Barcelona as destination. Bought a travel card and just used the metro system to get around - all the main attractions are easy to get to. Highly recommend Sagrada Familia Church well worth the entrance fee ( do go see the museum underneath) and a must see is Parc Guell (great panaoramic views of the city ) and lots of Gaudi design and the Mercat de la Boqueria just off Las Ramblas - definately for foodies, lots of lovely fresh produce and the displays of fish and seafood are amazing to see. Also if you have time walk along the beach front from the bottom of Las Ramblas to the Olympic Village. Food fantastic and lots of good lunchtime deals from all the restaurants. As it was my birthday we chose to eat my birthday evening meal at Can Culleretes which was not as expensive as we thought it would be and the food and the atmosphere were really special. Their evening set menu was well worth every penny. Its the oldest restaurant in the city and is just off Las Ramblas on Carrer Quintana. One word of warning - keep your eyes open on the metro for groups of women who hussle you onto the train and surround you. On our way back to the airport my bag (worn under my coat) was opened and they had out my passport ( from an inside zipped pocket) which was dropped on the floor as I had started yelling and causing a fuss about not being able to get away from them Im sure they would have had just about everything out of my bag in seconds. I had a lucky escape and since I have been back I have heard the same thing from other people. We stayed for three days and think this is just about the right length of time to see the main sights

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value”
Reviews.Author: fussyNewYork
Reviews.Content: This is a snazzy little hotel with sophisticated bedding and fixtures in the rooms and free Wifi that actually always worked. The front desk staff was helpful and pleasant. The location is not for everyone--in a residential area with very few decent restaurants. (We did make one find- a restaurant called Kudamm near the Hospital Clinic Metro station. It has food that is more modern and attractive than most of what we found, and at very reasonable prices.)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but with a good walk to the centre”
Reviews.Author: TGBWorcestershire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a city break at the end of January. The hotel is very modern, clean and sufficent for a weekend break. We caught the train from the airport and the hotel is then a 15 min walk from the train station. The staff were very friendly and helpful advising us about local transport and the tourist bus. The room was just big enough and had a wondrous view of concrete! The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was a good size and there was also a room safe. From the hotel it is about a 30-40 minute walk to the top of Las Ramblas which we did on several evenings. The nearest metro stations are about 5-7 minutes away but the metro is very clean and easy to use. We did try and use a taxi on the one evening when the heavens had opened - however all the taxis we approached mysteriously had a fault on their meters! Call us suspicious, but we didn't bother! We did have breakfast in the hotel on our last morning before we left for the airport - it wasn't worth 12Euros, but was OK and there was a fair selection on offer. On the other mornings we grabbed a sandwich or pastry on the go. We used the openair tourist bus to get around - this was good service and you had your own commentary via headphones. We got a 2 day ticket and literally hopped on and off meaning we saw all the main sights. The hotel is a good base for a weekend and if you are happy walking then I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for short break”
Reviews.Author: Gemjunkie
Reviews.Content: Got great deal - 3 nights for price of 2 on LastMinute .com. Check in was pleasant and we were given a choice of 4 rooms - double or twin - external or intenal - smoking or non-smoking - went for double internal view (large windows opening onto plain internal courtyard) as we did not want traffic noise. All reception staff were very helpful and polite with good travel advice. The sheets are very fine quality and towels lovely and thick - room had everything we needed - nice large bathroom, very clean but bath taps were awkward to get to as the shower screen was in the way. Proper blowdry hairdryer. The bed was superking and very comfortable with long slim bolster pillows (bit strange but you get used to it). We did not have breakfast as thought it a bit pricey at 12 euros but used minibar to store our own ham and cheese and bought fresh bread from the supermarket around the corner. Managed to fit in a bottle of cava too. We also bought our own travel kettle for coffee. The hotel is equal walking distance between 4 metro stations (about 7 mins) depending on what line you want. Buy a T10 for the metro 7.70 eros for 10 trips one card can be used by two people (or there are various travel cards). Used Bus Touristic (Hop on and off) on first day and did both North and South complete circuits to get our bearings - also good value if you then use the discount vouchers to visit Sagrada Familia and Casa Mila and Casa Batillo (Gaudi buildings) keeps costs down. Its 21 euros each for one day but we got it for £18.70 on easijet website (pick up tickets from Tourist Information office in the airport). We got the train from the airport (using one unit each on T10 ticket) to Barcelona Sants station and walked straight ahead to Via Roma for 10 minutes to reach the hotel. On the way home the airport bus stops 2 minutes from the hotel. (on the way it stops about four blocks down as most roads in Barca are one way). Barcelona is a stunning city with everything - sea, beach for summer - beautiful architecture, sculptures, parks and shop around for resonably priced food - always more expensive to eat outside as in all Eurpoean cities. Great baguettes from Pans - try the small bar/restauants where the Spanish eat for value. Also all you can eat buffets - Freshco about 11 euros. Take plenty of euros otherwise as all else quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Average clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: CityExplorers
Reviews.Content: Clean basic hotel. A little noisy at night. 10 minutes walk from nearest Metro. But not 4 star. Free wi-fi that does not work with mobiles.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Dangermouse68
Reviews.Content: Following very positive reviews on this hotel, we decided to book a stay here for 3 nights. It outlined it being only 20 minutes from the centre, although it was more like a 30 to 40 minute walk to the Ramblas, so would not be suitable for those wanting to be in the thick of things or those who are unable to walk long distances. We thought the hotel would be more welcoming than it was, but when we arrived, we were only asked for a credit card and whether we wanted breakfast - there was no warmness or assistance offered during our visit and there was no literature or maps of Barcelona in our room, which has often been the case when we have visited other European Cities. The hotel states it has a restaurant, but we didn't see this in use during our stay - only for breakfast which we declined due to the price. The soundproof rooms are not in fact sound proof and the volume of traffic travelling past the hotel is noisy. On the plus side, the rooms were clean, large and comfy with amenities provided. There were also some really nice little local bars and restaurants around the corner which we frequented and which were run by some really nice local people. A point of consideration - depending who you book with, your confirmation will be sent in a fixed sum of Euros to pay at the hotel, but beware that due to the fluctuation in the exchange, you could actually pay a lot more than you originally thought to stay here - we ended up being charged an extra £39.00.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing, promised lots but delivered very little.”
Reviews.Author: Welwyn_Spurs
Reviews.Content: I would liken this hotel to Jodie Marsh, all fur coat and no knickers. On arrival all my partner and I were very impressed, nice looking reception, quite background music and smiling reception staff. We checked in and were given our room card at which point the receptionist pointed to the lift in the corner, we had to ask which floor and where we could find the room, no offer was made to help us with our bags. When we found our room, again looked very nice, decent size room, very large bed, A/C and TV, I switched on the TV, it would only show German and Spanish channels despite the website and information pack telling me it would show English TV. I don’t go on holiday to watch but if I’m told TV is available I expect it to be available, I asked reception but they had no idea how to operate it. Also the shower would go hot and cold very quickly, meaning you had to jump in and out to prevent yourself burning. After our first day’s sightseeing my partner and I returned looking forward to a relaxing drink, we asked the receptionist to point us in the direction of the bar, only to be told the hotel didn’t have one, a four star hotel without a bar. We were then told we could sit in the reception and order some room service, luckily we found a very nice bar locally. On the following night we returned at 10.30 and asked for some room service but were told that as there was a small function going on in the hotel room service was not available, I repeat this is supposed to be a 4 star hotel. When checking out from the hotel, we weren’t asked how our stay was, hope you have a good trip, I would go as far to say they were very dismissive. In summary who ever rated this hotel as a 4 start could never of stayed at the hotel, it is sub standard and very disappointing, I’m returning to Barcelona in a couple of months time and will not be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean but warm and welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: mickrobbie
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights at the Amister and will be back for more .The staff were freindly and helpful and the room excellant . could have done with Tea and coffee facilities tho. The hotel is 15 to 20 mins easy and pleasant stroll to La Rambla or 10 mins to Sants station . A 5 star thumbs up from us both .

Reviews.Title: “Great city break”
Reviews.Author: Beckio
Reviews.Content: Hotel is really, really nice, every member of staff super friendly and efficient; couldn't do enough for us. Beds are huge, bathroom really nice, and well soundproofed. We didn't have the breakfast, but plenty of places to stop off for a pastry and coffee on the way into town. We ate at La Xerinola on La Ramblas which was nice and had a decent 'tourist menu' 29 Euros for 2 people. Also ate at La Tramoia which was equally good (google them for website). But by far the best meal we had was at an Argentinian restaurant called Gaucho's. Great food and service - if you like your meat you'll love this place. As mentioned by others, about 15 mins walk to the top of La Ramblas which is fine, although after 4 days of trekking there and back twice a day, plus all the walking in the city, we had plenty of blisters on our feet! Flew into Reus with Ryanair and got a coach into Sants station for 21 Euros return. The coach runs in time with the Ryanair flights so you know you'll get back to the airport in time for your flight. We crammed so much into the 3 full days we had there; the best thing we did was to get tickets for the Bus Turistic. Seems pricey at 27 Euros each for 2 days, but it helped us see so much; La Sagrada Familia, Montjuic, cable car, La Pedrera, Torre Agbar, Port Olimpic, Park Guell, FC Barcelona tour (including a match!), Port Vell, the Gothic Quarter. Weather was warmer than the UK at around 14 degrees, but you'll still need a coat. Barcelona isn't too crowded this time of year, and whatever you're into there's something there for you; shopping, culture, football etc. We'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Loving the Amister”
Reviews.Author: lillyandlionel
Reviews.Content: The Amister is a very clean, comfortable hotel about a 15 minute walk from Las Ramblas. Staff were very friendly and always had the answers for any questions we had. Rooms were very clean and had very good soundproofing. If I had to say one negative thing it would have to be the location but if you don't want to be in the hustle and bustle of being on Las Ramblas and want a quiet getaway hotel then this is the one for you. I will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: sentykid
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel...Modern, clean,good staff. We had a 2nights for the price of 3 which was great value.About a 20min walk down to the Ramblas area, wished it had been a little closer, but no real problem, nice quiet safe area. No tea making facilities which was a shame! b/fast was also a bit expensive £11(same as Euro) for a continental buffet. If you come out of the hotel, turn left down the Ave de Roma for a couple of blocks, on the left, you will find a nice Spanish cafe, coffee/toast, for about £3 really nice and friendly. Found Barcelona very expensive.....eating out etc...however came across a realy good Rest. near the bottom of Ramblas, turn left at a large white statue and it's up on the left.. La Fonda get there early 8pm other wise you will have a long wait. We only had three days but had a great time, the city bus is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel with attractive price”
Reviews.Author: Vstudy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was cozy and wonderful. We stayed at this Hotel with a family of 4. Bed size is spacious and mattress quality was also good. Above all, very clean, including bath room. Staff was friendly and very helpful. To Sants station, it is not so near taks 15-20 minutes. However, there is a regular bus service, and we did not have much problem. (To underground station only 10 minutes walk).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Gurugilly
Reviews.Content: A very good, modern hotel in a traditional building. Well furnished and decorated rooms, kingsize bed, full bathroom with bath and bidet. Good soundproofing, heating etc. No tea/coffee making facilities which was a drag. We had a 3 nights for the price of 2 deal, which made it exceptional value. Staff were charming and very helpful. Breakfast a bit pricey at 11 euros but it's a help yourself buffet, so if you've got a good appetite in the morning you can 'fuel up' for the day ahead! Alternatively there are local cafes that will do coffee and cake for 2-3 euros. The local area is a fairly well off residential district and the streets appeared safe. Plenty of choice of very good cafes, bars and restaurants. The hotel is ten minutes stroll from Urgell metro. The Aerobus from the airport drops you off at the metro but picks up on the return trip from a stop just 200 metres from the hotel (turn left out of the hotel and the stop is by the children's playground in the centre of the road).

Reviews.Title: “Last hotel I'll need”
Reviews.Author: hipcheck
Reviews.Content: Convenient to transportation and very affordable, we were expecting a decent stay...what we got was just a top-drawer hotel experience on all levels. The lobby, salons as well as our room were all quite nice, easily as nice as most hotels that cost twice the price. But the real bonus was the staff, who were extremely helpful, kind and available -- honestly about the nicest hotel staff I've dealt with. Our next trip to Barca will be booked here!

Reviews.Title: “LUXURY AT AN ECONOMICAL PRICE...SMALL, COZY BOUTIQUE”
Reviews.Author: corgiagility
Reviews.Content: Luxury at an economical price. Magnificent modern/graphic original art throughout lobby and rooms. "Small, cozy, definitely "Boutique"- Hotel. Large, spacious ind. rms. Glass front windows curve with hidden corner entrance, each with a different colored giant letter- together spelling "AMISTER". Truly a unique hotel sign, that blends into the neighborhood and sets the "modern mode" for the hotel decor!!! BEST BREAKFAST BUFFET OUR ENTIRE 40TH ANNIVERSARY TRIP, INCLUDING FOOD ABOARD OUR 12 DAY CRUISE. Staff goes out of their way: made 2 great recs for restaurants within 3 block walk. Overlooks/ is on an Esplanade- typical "Moderniste" apartments with balconies...locals walking their dogs,etc. Web site excellent with perfect driving directions from airport. (ONLY THING MISSING IS A HAND RAIL DOWN INSIDE CURVED MARBLE STEPS ENTRANCE- BUT THEN EUROPE IS NOT EXACTLY HANDICAP FRIENDLY.) STAFF CARRIED ALL LUGGAGE. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: speleszok
Reviews.Content: This hotel was 10 minutes from La Ramblas and easy to negotiate the city from the hotels location. There was a bus direct to the airport available from the street opposite and two metro stations nearby. It offered a good standard with clean rooms and friendly staff. A great place to stay to explore Barcelona if you want value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: rgoldberg
Reviews.Content: Everything was just as it has to be. Stylish interior, very clean, helpful and friendly staff. Great breakfast. Good location, 20 min walk from Plaza Catalonia. Airport shuttle one block from hotel. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “a gem - would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Edghillian
Reviews.Content: Room - very clean, good air con, nice beds, safe, good bathoom, and good tv. reception - very modern and helpful staff breakfast - very good selection of hot and cold food location - a bit off the beaten track, but if you can stand the 15 minute journey to the beach or city centre then this is well worth a punt.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Stranger_in_town
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - spotless and modern. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were spacious and immaculate. The breakfast buffet had a lot of choice and was nice and fresh. The croissants and pastries were delicious. If you book this hotel, do so via the website to get the breakfast included in the price of a night. The hotel was a bit far out of the centre of town but we didn't mind the walk to the metro station. Wish there had been a satellite TV channel in English but after all the walking I don't think I would have stayed awake for a whole programme anyway. What a fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Whizz
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for 2 nights and generally found the hotel to be alright. Th Good Points Staff friendly and helpful enough - recommended a couple of local fish resturants; allowed us to use their laptop to check-in to our flight on-line; gave us directions and good sight-seeing advice; good sized clean room with bigger than average beds; located within 5 mins walking distance from the airport bus stop; nice safe part of the city. The Bad Points Took us 1 hour 15 mins to check-in (there was a group pf delegates checking-out after a conference); the 11 euro breakfast while nice is seriously over-priced; the hotel is far from the city centre and a 10-12 mins brisk walking distance from Hospital Clinic (the nearest Metro station); our room was freezing as their heating was not working; there were no porters to help with baggage. Tips Coming from the airport to the city centre it's best to get the airport bus and get off at the second stop at Urgell. This means staying on the bus past Catalunya and Prestige Paseode Gracia. The bus then goes down Avenue de Roma. The city is best experienced during high season May to September as a lot of the attractions had restricted opening times or were closed completely Also the weather did not feel very Mediterranean and rained quite a bit which prevented us from visitng some of the oudoor attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Savethebesttilllast
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend who is vegan. We arrived at 10pm and the staff found us a vegetarian restaurant, printed out a map and rang ahead for us. The room had a lovely bathroom, was comfortable and had Sky tv and a mini bar but the bar gladly lent us a corkscrew to drink our own wine in our room. It is a couple of minutes walk from the airport bus stop with a fare 3.90 euros to the airport and buses every 15 mins. We were told the nearest tube is Sants, but it is actually Hospital Clinic, with a direct line into Seguda Familia..Gaudi's cathedral.Local bars are excellent, lots of tapas. One word of warning..you need to speak Spanish in this part of town, because there are few English speakers Overall, a terrific stay. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Gwelfite
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights. The bed was excellent; the room nicely furnished, clean and pleasantly modern; likewise the hotel itself. The bathroom was neat and clean with fine towels and lots of shelf space. The bath/shower was great for baths; showers were more difficult, as in most other Spanish hotels. Is there a trick to using them? Insert the room key in a slot on the wall inside the door or lights won't work, as in other Spanish hotels. We found walking to medieval Barcelona and La Rambla from the hotel and walking when we got there, was too much. It's better to get a cab by the hotel - fares are modest, lower than in North America, by our experience. Hotel staff were very helpful, giving directions to the subway stations for various destinations and suggesting nearby restaurants. Buffet breakfasts at the hotel were superb, with a great range of foods, juices, waters and coffee. If we visit Barcelona again, we'll stay here again. The hotel was a quiet respite in this fascinating and beautiful, but hectic, busy, and crowded city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kateshiner
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a good location. 5-10 minutes walk from Sant Estacio which has 3 train lines but only a 5 minute walk to Estrenca. Clean, big rooms with good bathrooms - with a bath! We didn't have breakfast because there are lots of lovely bakeries nearby selling croissants and pastries. Reception staff were really friendly and helpful - let us leave our bags there on our last day, gave us their laptop to borrow and were generally v good. Only one complaint - the air conditioning in our room was a bit tempremental so it was quite warm but I'm sure that if we'd bothered to complain, the hotel would have fixed it or moved us to a different room.

Reviews.Title: “This is The Way It Should Be!”
Reviews.Author: DarrenShaw
Reviews.Content: I recommend you call directly or book on thier website for best price. But this hotel is the best. you can get off the train and walk to this hotel. plenty of sights and area to discover close by and the staff recommened the best bars that you find locals at. LOVE IT!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value”
Reviews.Author: leeclump5
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 nights at the hotel, booked last minute direct with the hotel, only £47 per night per room. Very modern hotel, friendly staff which speak excellent english. Good location, can walk to several metro stations. Very close to the Aerobus stop, which is an excellent service to and from the airport. Breakfast 9euros, was buffet style, included excellent fresh fruits, cereals, cooked breakfast, toast and croissant selection. Well worth it, and went on untill 11am! Every room has quick and free internet access, if you dont have a wireless card then just ask for a cable. If you dont have your own computer you can try ask at Reception, we saw a couple of people using a hotel laptop, but if not there are many internet cafes down the road. The hotel is about 5-10min walk from several station, including Sants, Roqueford and Tarragon. Perhaps a little far if travelling with young children. Would strongly recommend this hotel! Excellent quality and service! Look on their website [--]

HotelInfo.Name: Amister Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Avda. de Roma 93-95, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
